2025-12-16.content:
[Strict act-as mode](https://docs.cloud.google.com/dataform/docs/strict-act-as-mode)
for Dataform is now
[generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages)
(GA). This feature enhances security by requiring users to have the
`iam.serviceAccounts.actAs` permission on the service account used to run
workflows, ensuring a more secure and predictable permissions model for your
Dataform projects.

summary.title: Dataform Strict Act-As Mode Now GA
summary.summary: Dataform's Strict Act-As mode is now generally available, enhancing security by requiring explicit `iam.serviceAccounts.actAs` permissions for workflow execution. This ensures a more secure and predictable permissions model for your Dataform projects.

2025-12-15.content:
You can verify and resolve `iam.serviceAccounts.actAs` permission issues in
Dataform by checking Cloud Logging, interpreting log entries, and granting the
necessary IAM roles. For more information, see
[Verify act-as permissions for the effective service account](https://docs.cloud.google.com/dataform/docs/strict-act-as-mode#verify-permissions).
This feature is in
[preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Resolve service account permission issues in Dataform
summary.summary: New tooling in Dataform helps you identify and fix `iam.serviceAccounts.actAs` permission problems. You can now check Cloud Logging to diagnose these issues and grant the appropriate IAM roles to resolve them. This feature is currently in preview.

2025-12-09.content:
Dataform offers
[enhanced IAM permissions](https://docs.cloud.google.com/dataform/docs/access-control#use-config-api),
providing more granular control over resource creation and scheduling.
Administrators can also
[enable private workspaces](https://docs.cloud.google.com/dataform/docs/access-control#enable-private-workspaces)
to restrict access to the workspace creator. These features are in
[preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Dataform enhances access control
summary.summary: Dataform now provides more granular IAM permissions for resource creation and scheduling. Administrators can also enable private workspaces for restricted access. These new capabilities are currently in preview.

2025-11-18.content:
Dataform now lets you automate the creation of
[BigLake tables for Apache Iceberg in BigQuery](https://docs.cloud.google.com/dataform/docs/create-tables#create-iceberg-table).
This feature is
[generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages)
(GA).

summary.title: Dataform Now Supports BigLake Tables for Apache Iceberg
summary.summary: Dataform now supports the automation of BigLake table creation for Apache Iceberg in BigQuery. This feature is now generally available.

2025-11-13.content:
You can use custom constraints with Organization Policy to provide more
granular control over specific fields for the `CompilationResult`,
`ReleaseConfig`, `WorkflowConfig`, `WorkflowInvocation`, and `Workspace`
resources. For more information, see
[Create custom organization policy constraints](https://docs.cloud.google.com/dataform/docs/create-custom-constraints).
This feature is
[generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages)
(GA).

summary.title: Custom constraints for Dataform resources
summary.summary: Organization policy now supports custom constraints for granular control over specific fields in CompilationResult, ReleaseConfig, WorkflowConfig, WorkflowInvocation, and Workspace resources.

2025-10-06.content:
You can now use custom constraints with Organization Policy to provide more
granular control over specific fields for some Dataform
resources. For more information, see
[Create custom organization policy constraints](https://docs.cloud.google.com/dataform/docs/create-custom-constraints).
This feature is
[generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages)
(GA).

summary.title: New controls for Dataform resources
summary.summary: Organization Policy now supports custom constraints for Dataform, offering finer control over specific fields. This generally available feature allows for more granular management of Dataform resources.

2025-10-06.content:
You can now set the priority of BigQuery jobs in Dataform
to run queries as interactive jobs that start running as quickly as possible
or as batch jobs with lower priority. For more information, see
[Create a workflow configuration](https://docs.cloud.google.com/dataform/docs/schedule-runs#create-workflow-configuration)
and
[InvocationConfig](https://docs.cloud.google.com/dataform/reference/rest/v1/InvocationConfig).
This feature is
[generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages)
(GA).

summary.title: Set BigQuery job priority in Dataform
summary.summary: You can now set the priority of BigQuery jobs in Dataform to run queries as interactive jobs that start running as quickly as possible or as batch jobs with lower priority.

2025-09-08.content: You can now [update an incremental table schema without a full table refresh](https://cloud.google.com/dataform/docs/#change-schema-without-refresh). This feature is in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Schema Updates Without Full Refresh
summary.summary: You can now update an incremental table schema without a full table refresh. This feature is in Preview.

2025-09-02.content: Dataform now automatically selects a processing location based on the datasets referenced in your SQL queries. This makes setting the default location optional in your workflow configurations. For more information, see [About repository settings](https://cloud.google.com/dataform/docs/manage-repository#repository-settings). This feature is [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Dataform automatically selects processing location
summary.summary: Dataform now automatically selects a processing location based on the datasets referenced in your SQL queries, making the default location optional in your workflow configurations. This feature is generally available.

2025-08-21.content:
A security vulnerability was discovered in the Dataform API. This vulnerability could potentially allow unauthorized access to customer code repositories and data. For more information, see
[GCP-2025-045 security bulletin](https://cloud.google.com/dataform/docs/security-bulletins#gcp-2025-045).

2025-07-14.content: Updates to the automatic cataloging of Dataform metadata in Dataplex improve the near real-time [management](https://cloud.google.com/dataplex/docs/catalog-overview) and [search](https://cloud.google.com/dataplex/docs/search-assets) capabilities for repository metadata. These features are [generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA).

summary.title: Dataform Metadata Management in Dataplex Updated
summary.summary: Dataplex now offers improved near real-time management and search for Dataform repository metadata, with features now generally available. This update enhances how users interact with and find information within their data catalogs.

2025-06-12.content: Dark theme is now available for BigQuery and Dataform. To turn on the dark theme, go to the Console, open the **Settings and utilities** menu next to your avatar, and select **Preferences**. On the **User preferences** page, select **Appearance** in the navigation, select your color theme, and save your selection.

summary.title: Dark Theme Now Available for BigQuery and Dataform
summary.summary: You can now enable dark theme for BigQuery and Dataform. Access this feature through the User Preferences page under Appearance settings in the Console.

2025-05-29.content: You can now use your Google Account user credentials to authorize the creation, scheduling, and running of pipelines, the scheduling of notebooks and data preparations, and the creation of workflow configurations. For more information, see [Schedule runs](https://cloud.google.com/dataform/docs/schedule-runs). This feature is in [preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Use Google Account Credentials for Authorization
summary.summary: You can now use your Google Account credentials to authorize pipeline creation, scheduling, and execution, as well as notebook scheduling and data preparation. Workflow configurations can also be created using these credentials. This feature is currently in preview.

2025-05-28.content: You can now use strict act-as mode to enable an additional security check for certain user actions in Dataform. For more information, see [Use strict act-as mode](https://cloud.google.com/dataform/docs/strict-act-as-mode). This feature is in [preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: New security feature in Dataform
summary.summary: Dataform now supports strict act-as mode, an enhanced security feature for user actions. This preview feature adds an extra layer of verification for specific operations.
